Class SimulatorFactory

java.lang.Object
ca.yorku.cmg.cnsim.engine.SimulatorFactory
public abstract class SimulatorFactory extends Object
A factory class responsible for constructing and assembling all the main components of a Simulation instance. This includes samplers, node sets, networks, transaction workloads, and reporting schedules.

The SimulatorFactory acts as a blueprint for simulation initialization: it configures the structure and dependencies of a simulation using parameters drawn from Config. Subclasses define how node sets are created by implementing createNodeSet(Simulation). Subclasses can also override any other component creation methods.

The overall lifecycle managed by this factory is:

  1. Create and attach a Sampler to the Simulation.
  2. Add node, network, and transaction samplers to the sampler.
  3. Create a PoWNodeSet using the subclassâ€™s implementation.
  4. Build and attach a network.
  5. Create and schedule a transaction workload.
  6. Schedule periodic belief reports.
  7. Apply a hard termination time for the simulation.
This class follows a template method pattern: createSimulation(int) defines the high-level assembly algorithm, while subclasses provide concrete details (such as how the node set is created).
Author:
Sotirios Liaskos for the Conceptual Modeling Group @ York University

  • Constructor Details

    • SimulatorFactory

      public SimulatorFactory()

  • Method Details

    • addNodeSampler

      public void addNodeSampler(Simulation s)
      Adds and configures the node sampler for the given simulation.

      The node sampler determines how nodes are selected or instantiated during simulation setup, according to parameters defined in Config:

      • node.sampler.file
      • node.sampler.seed
      • node.sampler.seedUpdateTimes
      • node.sampler.updateSeedFlags
      Parameters:
      s - the Simulation to which the node sampler will be attached

    • addNetworkSampler

      public void addNetworkSampler(Simulation s)
      Adds and configures the network sampler for the given simulation.

      The network sampler governs how communication links or network structures are sampled or generated. It reads configuration parameters such as:

      • net.sampler.seed
      • net.sampler.seed.updateSeed
      Parameters:
      s - the Simulation to which the network sampler will be attached

    • addTransactionSampler

      public void addTransactionSampler(Simulation s)
      Adds and configures the transaction sampler for the given simulation.

      The transaction sampler defines how workload transactions are selected or constructed, based on configuration entries such as:

      • workload.sampler.file
      Parameters:
      s - the Simulation to which the transaction sampler will be attached

    • createNodeSet

      public abstract NodeSet createNodeSet(Simulation s)
      Creates the NodeSet for the given simulation.

      Subclasses must implement this method to define how simulation nodes are instantiated or configured.

      Parameters:
      s - the Simulation for which the node set is created
      Returns:
      the NodeSet representing all participating nodes

    • addNetwork

      public void addNetwork(Simulation s, NodeSet ns)
      Creates and attaches the network component to the given simulation.

      If net.sampler.file is defined in the configuration, a FileBasedEndToEndNetwork is created from that file. Otherwise, a RandomEndToEndNetwork is generated based on the sampler.

      Parameters:
      s - the simulation to which the network will be added
      ns - the NodeSet containing all nodes participating in the network

    • setHardTerminationTime

      public void setHardTerminationTime(Simulation s)
      Sets a hard termination time for the simulation based on the sim.terminate.atTime property in Config.
      Parameters:
      s - the Simulation for which to set the termination time

    • scheduleBeliefReports

      public void scheduleBeliefReports(Simulation s)
      Schedules periodic belief report events within the simulation.

      Belief reports summarize internal simulation states and are scheduled using ReportEventFactory, with parameters:

      • reporter.beliefReportInterval
      • reporter.beliefReportOffset
      Parameters:
      s - the Simulation for which belief reporting is configured

    • createSimulation

      public Simulation createSimulation(int simID)
      Creates and fully configures a new Simulation instance.

      This method encapsulates the entire setup pipeline for a simulation:

      1. Creates the simulation object.
      2. Initializes and attaches a new Sampler.
      3. Adds node, network, and transaction samplers.
      4. Builds the NodeSet (delegated to subclass).
      5. Constructs and attaches a network.
      6. Creates and schedules the transaction workload.
      7. Schedules belief reporting events.
      8. Applies the hard termination time.
      Parameters:
      simID - a unique identifier for the simulation
      Returns:
      a fully initialized and ready-to-run Simulation
